verses.text: The words of the Preacher, the son of David, king in Jerusalem.

similars.text: And Jesus answered and said, while he taught in the temple, How say the scribes that Christ is the Son of David?
And he said unto them, How say they that Christ is David's son?
Saying, What think ye of Christ? whose son is he? They say unto him, The Son of David.
And the king said: Is God that Great Spirit that brought our fathers out of the land of Jerusalem?
David therefore himself calleth him Lord; and whence is he then his son? And the common people heard him gladly.
Nathanael answered and saith unto him, Rabbi, thou art the Son of God; thou art the King of Israel.
David therefore calleth him Lord, how is he then his son?

And when he had removed him, he raised up unto them David to be their king; to whom also he gave testimony, and said, I have found David the son of Jesse, a man after mine own heart, which shall fulfil all my will.
If David then call him Lord, how is he his son?
And when he had thus spoken, he went before, ascending up to Jerusalem.

verses.text: Vanity of vanities, saith the Preacher, vanity of vanities; all is vanity.

similars.text: Which vanity and unbelief have brought the whole church under condemnation.
Thefts, covetousness, wickedness, deceit, lasciviousness, an evil eye, blasphemy, pride, foolishness:

Wo unto them that draw iniquity with cords of vanity, and sin as it were with a cart rope;

And if Christ be not risen, then is our preaching vain, and your faith is also vain.
Behold, all these properties are mine, or else your faith is vain, and ye are found hypocrites, and the covenants which ye have made unto me are broken;

And now behold, my beloved brethren, I say unto you, do not suppose that this is all; for after ye have done all these things, if ye turn away the needy, and the naked, and visit not the sick and afflicted, and impart of your substance, if ye have, to those who stand in need--I say unto you, if ye do not any of these things, behold, your prayer is vain, and availeth you nothing, and ye are as hypocrites who do deny the faith.
Knowing that he that is such is subverted, and sinneth, being condemned of himself.

verses.text: What profit hath a man of all his labour which he taketh under the sun?

similars.text: For what shall it profit a man, if he shall gain the whole world, and lose his own soul?

Even as I please all men in all things, not seeking mine own profit, but the profit of many, that they may be saved.
What doth it profit, my brethren, though a man say he hath faith, and have not works? can faith save him?
Now he that planteth and he that watereth are one: and every man shall receive his own reward according to his own labour.
And whosoever doeth this must receive his wages of him; therefore, for his wages he receiveth death, as to things pertaining unto righteousness, being dead unto all good works.
Let him that stole steal no more: but rather let him labour, working with his hands the thing which is good, that he may have to give to him that needeth.

For what doth it profit a man if a gift is bestowed upon him, and he receive not the gift? Behold, he rejoices not in that which is given unto him, neither rejoices in him who is the giver of the gift.

verses.text: One generation passeth away, and another generation cometh: but the earth abideth for ever.

similars.text: And their generations shall inherit the earth from generation to generation, forever and ever. And now I make an end of speaking unto you. Even so. Amen.

And the world passeth away, and the lust thereof: but he that doeth the will of God abideth for ever.
And the end shall come, and the heaven and the earth shall be consumed and pass away, and there shall be a new heaven and a new earth.

verses.text: The sun also ariseth, and the sun goeth down, and hasteth to his place where he arose.

similars.text: And thus, according to his word the earth goeth back, and it appeareth unto man that the sun standeth still; yea, and behold, this is so; for surely it is the earth that moveth and not the sun.

verses.text: All the rivers run into the sea; yet the sea is not full; unto the place from whence the rivers come, thither they return again.

verses.text: All things are full of labour; man cannot utter it: the eye is not satisfied with seeing, nor the ear filled with hearing.

similars.text: Of whom we have many things to say, and hard to be uttered, seeing ye are dull of hearing.

If any man have ears to hear, let him hear.

verses.text: The thing that hath been, it is that which shall be; and that which is done is that which shall be done: and there is no new thing under the sun.

verses.text: I the Preacher was king over Israel in Jerusalem.

verses.text: And I gave my heart to seek and search out by wisdom concerning all things that are done under heaven: this sore travail hath God given to the sons of man to be exercised therewith.

similars.text: And I do this for a wise purpose; for thus it whispereth me, according to the workings of the Spirit of the Lord which is in me. And now, I do not know all things; but the Lord knoweth all things which are to come; wherefore, he worketh in me to do according to his will.

verses.text: For in much wisdom is much grief: and he that increaseth knowledge increaseth sorrow.
